static const int32_t ALIGN_MARGINS = 0x00000001
 The bounds of each view are extended outwards, according to their margins, before the edges of the resulting rectangle are aligned.

Detailed Description

A layout that places its children in a rectangular grid.

The grid is composed of a set of infinitely thin lines that separate the viewing area into cells. Throughout the API, grid lines are referenced by grid indices. A grid with N columns has N + 1 grid indices that run from 0 through N inclusive.

The following example demonstrates how to use the GridController

      Scene* scene = Scene::SceneFactory(this);
      // Create a GridController instance.
      GridController* mGridController = new GridController(this);

      GridController::Spec* titleRow = GridController::spec(0);
      GridController::Spec* centerInAllColumns =
          GridController::spec(0, 4, GridController::CENTER);

      Button* btn = new Button(this);
      mpGridController->addWidget(btn,
          new GridControllerParams(titleRow, centerInAllColumns));
      scene->attachController(mGridController);
      scene->setupSceneLayout();

bool gaia::ui::GridController::isColumnOrderPreserved ( ) const

Gets whether or not column boundaries are ordered by their grid indices.

Return true if column boundaries must appear in the order of their indices, false otherwise.

bool gaia::ui::GridController::isRowOrderPreserved ( ) const

Gets whether or not row boundaries are ordered by their grid indices.

Return true if row boundaries must appear in the order of their indices, false otherwise.

void gaia::ui::GridController::setAlignmentMode ( int32_t  alignmentMode)

Sets the alignment mode to be used for all of the alignments between the children of this container.

Parameters:
alignmentModeEither ALIGN_BOUNDS or ALIGN_MARGINS
void gaia::ui::GridController::setColumnCount ( int32_t  columnCount)

ColumnCount is used only to generate default column/column indices when they are not specified by a component's layout parameters.

Parameters:
columnCountThe number of columns.
void gaia::ui::GridController::setColumnOrderPreserved ( bool  columnOrderPreserved)

When this property is true, GridLayout is forced to place the column boundaries so that their associated grid indices are in ascending order in the view.

When this property is false GridLayout is at liberty to place the horizontal column boundaries in whatever order best fits the given constraints.

Parameters:
columnOrderPreservedUse true to force GridLayout to respect the order of column boundaries.
void gaia::ui::GridController::setOrientation ( int32_t  orientation)

To control which axis should be processed first during the layout operation.

Parameters:
orientationEither HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL.
void gaia::ui::GridController::setRowCount ( int32_t  rowCount)

RowCount is used only to generate default row/column indices when they are not specified by a component's layout parameters.

Parameters:
rowCountThe number of rows.
void gaia::ui::GridController::setRowOrderPreserved ( bool  rowOrderPreserved)

When this property is true, GridLayout is forced to place the row boundaries so that their associated grid indices are in ascending order in the view.

When this property is false GridLayout is at liberty to place the vertical row boundaries in whatever order best fits the given constraints.

Parameters:
rowOrderPreservedUse true to force GridLayout to respect the order of row boundaries
void gaia::ui::GridController::setUseDefaultMargins ( bool  useDefaultMargins)

When true, GridLayout allocates default margins around children based on the child's visual characteristics.

Each of the margins so defined may be independently overridden by an assignment to the appropriate layout parameter. When false, the default value of all margins is zero.

Parameters:
useDefaultMarginsUse true to make GridLayout allocate default margins
